name: haiberdyn-terminals-4-vscode
description: Unchains your chat-based agent's terminal access. Replacement for run_in_terminal that enables Copilot to access all your terminal profiles (WSL, PowerShell, Git Bash, Ubuntu, cmd) instead of just one default shell.
author: HaiberDyn

languageModelTools.name: haiberdyn_open_terminal_profile
languageModelTools.userDescription: Opens a terminal using a VS Code terminal profile. Use this in place of run_in_terminal for terminal operations. Supports profile names like WSL, Git Bash, and PowerShell.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens a terminal using a VS Code terminal profile (e.g., 'WSL', 'Git Bash', 'PowerShell'). Use this in place of run_in_terminal for terminal operations.

profileName.description: Name of VS Code terminal profile to launch (case-sensitive)

languageModelTools.name: haiberdyn_execute_in_terminal
languageModelTools.userDescription: Execute commands in various terminal environments (PowerShell, WSL, Git Bash, Ubuntu, cmd) with persistent terminal pooling. Use this in place of run_in_terminal for all terminal command execution.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Execute commands in various terminal environments (PowerShell, WSL, Git Bash, etc.) with persistent terminal pooling for context preservation. Use this in place of run_in_terminal.

command.description: The command to execute in the terminal

shell_type.description: The shell environment to execute in. Uses persistent terminal pool.

working_dir.description: Optional working directory for command execution

show_terminal.description: Whether to show the terminal in the UI (default: true)
